metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14373 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use after free was found in igc_reloc_struct_ptr() of psi/igc.c ofghostscript-9.25. A local attacker could supply a specially crafted PDFfile to cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.13
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.13
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.13
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.13
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.13').
